meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be extracted.
meanings.sent1: The extractability of the juice from the fruit was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The extractability of information from the database was crucial for the project.
meanings.sent3: The extractability of jokes from the comedian's mind seemed endless.
meanings.sent4: Her extractability of emotions in her writing was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The extractability of colors in the painting made it come alive.

meanings.definition: The ability to be removed or taken out.
meanings.sent1: The extractability of the stain from the fabric was challenging.
meanings.sent2: The extractability of the key from the lock was a relief.
meanings.sent3: The extractability of cookies from the jar was too tempting to resist.
meanings.sent4: His extractability of ideas from discussions was always insightful.
meanings.sent5: The extractability of stars from the night sky was mesmerizing.
